title: Julia Alboredo
text:
Julia Alboredo (born 12 January 1997) is a Brazilian chess player. She was awarded the title of <a href="Woman%20FIDE%20Master">Woman FIDE Master</a> in 2013. Alboredo is the 2020 Brazilian women's champion.
Chess career.
She has represented Brazil in the <a href="Chess%20Olympiad">Chess Olympiad</a>:
She qualified for the <a href="Women%27s%20Chess%20World%20Cup%202021">Women's Chess World Cup 2021</a> after finishing second in the <a href="Brazilian%20Chess%20Championship">Brazilian Chess Championship</a> after winner <a href="Juliana%20Sayumi%20Terao">Juliana Sayumi Terao</a> declined the invitation. She was defeated 1½-½ in the first round by <a href="Jolanta%20Zawadzka">Jolanta Zawadzka</a>.
